snippet.textDisplay: Shit, this brings many memories back, even if the game wasn't super balanced and it was super grindy, it was still a great game, the people that played it made it super fun and I still think about some of my Maple friends every once in a while. I remember trying to do a PQ and spending hours trying to get enough people to do it, and since there wasn't much to do while waiting, you'd chat with the guys you already found or the members of your guild, or going to Henesys to see your friends because you got bored of leveling and you just wanted to chill and mess around, I don't regret any minute I spent playing this game, even if it was P2W and super imba lol .
snippet.textOriginal: Shit, this brings many memories back, even if the game wasn't super balanced and it was super grindy, it was still a great game, the people that played it made it super fun and I still think about some of my Maple friends every once in a while. I remember trying to do a PQ and spending hours trying to get enough people to do it, and since there wasn't much to do while waiting, you'd chat with the guys you already found or the members of your guild, or going to Henesys to see your friends because you got bored of leveling and you just wanted to chill and mess around, I don't regret any minute I spent playing this game, even if it was P2W and super imba lol .

snippet.textDisplay: Encounter with the Buddha is by far my favorite MapleStory track. I started playing MapleStory in about 2007 I believe. I know for a fact Ludibrium wasn't released. Ludibrium has some noteworthy tunes as well namely, Path of Time. Fantastic upload SupraDarky.
snippet.textOriginal: Encounter with the Buddha is by far my favorite MapleStory track. I started playing MapleStory in about 2007 I believe. I know for a fact Ludibrium wasn't released. Ludibrium has some noteworthy tunes as well namely, Path of Time. Fantastic upload SupraDarky.

snippet.textDisplay: @Luculyia de Voltazux I don't play too many MMOs but I can tell you for certain that just about every Korean MMO from Nexon that I've played has a stellar soundtrack. Love Maple (including a few of the newer tracks,) Mabinogi, Vindictus (even though there's only like 4 pieces of music in the game xD) all wonderful. I also love the soundtrack for Tera, another Korean MMO.

snippet.textDisplay:
@SupraDarky The fact that they have added story modes to EVERY class that you choose honestly does make it better.  I just finished the Adventurer's story mode (finishes once you hit level 100) and it was rather enjoyable for an mmorpg at least.

The newer tracks, while some are good, kinda feel like they lack the same charm that the tracks from when the game first came out did.  Lith Harbour is still one of the best tracks, and the song that plays in the slime tree was honestly enjoyable.  The new stuff is starting to sound like typical MMO fanfare, while the original music kinda was in a league of its own for an mmo.
snippet.textOriginal:
@SupraDarky The fact that they have added story modes to EVERY class that you choose honestly does make it better.  I just finished the Adventurer's story mode (finishes once you hit level 100) and it was rather enjoyable for an mmorpg at least.

The newer tracks, while some are good, kinda feel like they lack the same charm that the tracks from when the game first came out did.  Lith Harbour is still one of the best tracks, and the song that plays in the slime tree was honestly enjoyable.  The new stuff is starting to sound like typical MMO fanfare, while the original music kinda was in a league of its own for an mmo.

snippet.textDisplay:
@SupraDarky IMO, it's way worse. The best of MapleStory's soundtrack was composed during its early stages like a decade ago. If you browse through SlipySlidy's channel, you can see a huge difference in quality comparing the new to the old tracks IMO... MapleStory 2 remixes old Maple tracks, but makes it more... "bubbly" and it isn't an improvement...

Well, most MMO soundtracks suck nowadays compared to the past. The only new one I'm actually looking forward to is Tree of Savior's one =S
